Package gov.sandia.geotess

Class GradientCalculator

java.lang.Object
gov.sandia.geotess.GradientCalculator
public class GradientCalculator
extends java.lang.Object
An attribute gradient calculator used to linearly estimate attribute gradients at arbitrary positions within a defining GeoTessModel. A small tetrahedron is used to linearly interpolate the gradient of an attribute field variable in a 3D since. This was taken directly from Sandy Ballard's equivalent (SmallTet) defined for the old GMP GeoModel object. Some modifications were made to support general attribute gradients.
Author:
jrhipp

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    GradientCalculator​(GeoTessModel model, double tetSize)
    Creates a linear horizontal and radial interpolator (GeoTessPosition) to evaluate the gradient and sets the small tetrahedron scaled to the input size (tetSize in km).
    GradientCalculator​(GeoTessModel model, double tetSize, gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals.InterpolatorType horizType)
    Creates an interpolator of horizontal type horizType (LINEAR or NATURAL_NEIGHBOR) used to evaluate the gradient and sets the small tetrahedron scaled to the input size (tetSize in km).

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void getGradient​(double[] vunit, double radius, int attributeIndex, int layerId, boolean reciprocal, double[] gradient)

    Calculates the attribute gradient at the input position vector (vunit * radius).

  • Constructor Details

    • GradientCalculator

      public GradientCalculator​(GeoTessModel model, double tetSize) throws GeoTessException
      Creates a linear horizontal and radial interpolator (GeoTessPosition) to evaluate the gradient and sets the small tetrahedron scaled to the input size (tetSize in km).
      Parameters:
      model - The GeoTessModel whose attribute and grid fields are to be used in calculating the gradient.
      tetSize - The size of the small tetrahedron (km).
      Throws:
      GeoTessException

    • GradientCalculator

      public GradientCalculator​(GeoTessModel model, double tetSize, gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals.InterpolatorType horizType) throws GeoTessException
      Creates an interpolator of horizontal type horizType (LINEAR or NATURAL_NEIGHBOR) used to evaluate the gradient and sets the small tetrahedron scaled to the input size (tetSize in km).
      Parameters:
      model - The GeoTessModel whose attribute and grid fields are to be used in calculating the gradient.
      tetSize - The size of the small tetrahedron (km).
      horizType - The horizontal interpolator type (LINEAR or NATURAL_NEIGHBOR).
      Throws:
      GeoTessException

  • Method Details

    • getGradient

      public void getGradient​(double[] vector, int attributeIndex, int layerId, boolean reciprocal, float[] gradient) throws GeoTessException
      Calculates the attribute gradient at the input position vector. The position is constrained (if necessary) to lie within the specified layer. If reciprocal is true the inverse gradient is returned.
      Parameters:
      vector - The full 3-component vector where the gradient is to be computed.
      attributeIndex - The attribute index for which the gradient is to be evaluated.
      layerId - The layer id within which the calculation is constrained.
      reciprocal - Boolean flag, that if true, causes the inverse gradient to be returned.
      gradient - The resulting gradient.
      Throws:
      GeoTessException

    • getGradient

      public void getGradient​(double[] vector, int attributeIndex, int layerId, boolean reciprocal, double[] gradient) throws GeoTessException
      Calculates the attribute gradient at the input position vector. The position is constrained (if necessary) to lie within the specified layer. If reciprocal is true the inverse gradient is returned.

      attributeIndex - The attribute index for which the gradient is to be evaluated.
      layerId - The layer id within which the calculation is constrained.

      GeoTessException

    • getGradient

      public void getGradient​(double[] vunit, double radius, int attributeIndex, int layerId, boolean reciprocal, float[] gradient) throws GeoTessException
      Calculates the attribute gradient at the input position vector (vunit * radius). The position radius is constrained (if necessary) to lie within the specified layer. If reciprocal is true the inverse gradient is returned.
      Parameters:
      vunit - The unit vector where the gradient is to be computed.
      radius - The radius of the position where the gradient is to be computed.
      attributeIndex - The attribute index for which the gradient is to be evaluated.
      layerId - The layer id within which the calculation is constrained.
      reciprocal - Boolean flag, that if true, causes the inverse gradient to be returned.
      gradient - The resulting gradient.
      Throws:
      GeoTessException

    • getGradient

      public void getGradient​(double[] vunit, double radius, int attributeIndex, int layerId, boolean reciprocal, double[] gradient) throws GeoTessException
      Calculates the attribute gradient at the input position vector (vunit * radius). The position radius is constrained (if necessary) to lie within the specified layer. If reciprocal is true the inverse gradient is returned.
      Parameters:

      radius - The radius of the position where the gradient is to be computed.
      attributeIndex - The attribute index for which the gradient is to be evaluated.
      layerId - The layer id within which the calculation is constrained.
      reciprocal - Boolean flag, that if true, causes the inverse gradient to be returned.
